(figures provided by NASA in 1999)Although some authorities think it may eventually come down to mere $5 billion per gram.There is absolutely No match for this most expensive element on earth.  Since there is no match for Antimatter on earth, here is another thing though it is violating the limits of the question a bit Scientists in 2004  discovered cosmic diamond, a chunk of crystallized carbon 50 light-years from the Earth in the constellation Centaurus, “Some people refer to it as ‘Lucy’ in a tribute to the Beatles song ‘Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds.’”Now Cost of 1 carat of pure diamond in approximately $ 20,000 ,  Lucy is 2,500 miles across and weighs 5 million trillion trillion pounds, which translates to approximately 10 Decillion carats, So Lucy's price would be about  $0.2 Duodecillion i.e. 2 followed by 38 zeros.  Coming back to earth, dealing in a considerable range-few hundred thousands to millionsGold has been a precious metal for a very long time,it is status of wealth and prosperity, our currency backed by gold , well the precious Gold is cheapest here , it is ONLY $40 per gram  Plutonium , cost roughly around  $4,000 per gram , still cheap   Tritium costs $30,000 per gram - somewhat costly  Californium 252, one pound of Californium would cost 350 billion dollars , meaning 1 gram costs about $780 million.  Botulinum Toxin - quite familiar name but it is the most poisonous substance known to man. A couple of teaspoons would be enough to kill everyone in the UK. A couple of kilos would kill every human on earth.  Is it expensive ? Yes, it costs only $139 Billion per gram (as per data by BBC) Lastly, since expensive is also a relative term we must know that 1 USD was also very expensive some time ago, atleast for country like Zimbabwe, On February 2013,  $1 was equivalent to  $92,233,720,368,547,760 Zimbabwe Dollars !! , Yeah, that's right. 1 U.S. dollar gets more than 92 quadrillion Zimbabwe dollars. Zimbabwe doesn't even use its own currency anymore; it now uses U.S. dollars for everyday transactions. This is what happens when a country lets inflation(hyper inflation) happen, becoming dependent on foreign currency instead of their own. That's it.Source : Internet, BBC, Wikipedia.
